info.title: Stellarcarbon API
info.summary: Protect the rainforest with Stellarcarbon. Breathing space, preserved.
info.description:
This API is ideal for developers and businesses looking to integrate CO₂ compensation into their existing products. It is permissionless: you don't need an API key. We publish an OpenAPI schema which can be used to automatically generate API clients for many programming languages, making your integration easy to set up and maintain.

See the API in action within our dApp: <https://new.stellarcarbon.io>

There is an official SDK based on our OpenAPI schema for JS/TS: <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@stellarcarbon/sc-sdk>

The interactive documentation below is organized into categories. It specifies — for each endpoint — the request and response schemas. Use the "try it out" button to unlock the form fields, and confirm with "execute" to get an actual response from the API.

get.summary: Request a SEP-10 challenge transaction to prove ownership of an account.
get.description:
Build and return a SEP-10 challenge transaction (XDR) that a client can sign to prove control
of a Stellar account.

The endpoint implements the SEP-10 "web authentication" challenge generation:
- Validates input (e.g. prevents providing a memo together with a muxed account).
- Calls internal.generate_challenge() to create a challenge TransactionEnvelope signed by the
  server's API signer.
- Returns the base64 XDR and the network passphrase the client must use when signing.

Parameters:
- account: Stellar account that will sign the challenge (G... or M...).
- memo: Optional numeric memo to be associated with the authenticated subject. If provided,
  the final JWT 'sub' claim will be "G...:memo". Do not provide when using an M-address.
- home_domain: The anchor's home domain (used when building the challenge).
- client_domain: Optional client domain; when present the challenge includes a ManageData op
  for the client domain per SEP-10.

Returns:
- transaction: base64-encoded TransactionEnvelope XDR that the client must sign.
- network_passphrase: the Stellar network passphrase to be used when signing the transaction.

Errors:
- 422: invalid combination of parameters (e.g. memo with muxed account).
- 400: Stellar SDK error while building the challenge.

parameters.name: account

schema.description: Stellar account public key to prove ownership of (G... or M...)
schema.title: Account

parameters.description: Stellar account public key to prove ownership of (G... or M...)

parameters.name: memo

schema.description: Optional 64-bit integer memo to include in the 'sub' value of the resulting JWT. Must not be provided when `account` is a muxed address (M...).
schema.title: Memo

parameters.description: Optional 64-bit integer memo to include in the 'sub' value of the resulting JWT. Must not be provided when `account` is a muxed address (M...).

parameters.name: home_domain

schema.description: Stellarcarbon's home domain (defaults to server configuration).
schema.title: Home Domain

parameters.description: Stellarcarbon's home domain (defaults to server configuration).

parameters.name: client_domain

schema.description: Optional client/wallet domain to include in the challenge's ManageData op.
schema.title: Client Domain

parameters.description: Optional client/wallet domain to include in the challenge's ManageData op.

400.description: Credentials or challenge failed to validate.

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

post.summary: Submit the signed SEP-10 challenge transaction to receive a JWT.
post.description:
Validate a signed SEP-10 challenge and issue a JSON Web Token (JWT) representing the authenticated session.

The request accepts the signed challenge transaction either as:
- a query parameter named `transaction` containing the base64 XDR, or
- a JSON body with a top-level `transaction` field.

Validation performed:
- The signed challenge XDR is parsed and validated according to SEP-10 rules (read_challenge_transaction).
- If the client's Stellar account exists on-chain, signatures are checked against account signers and
  the medium threshold requirement is enforced.
- If the account does not exist, the client's master key signature is sufficient.
- On successful validation a JWT is generated with claims per SEP-10:
  iss (web auth URL), sub (authenticated account or muxed address, possibly with ":memo"),
  iat/exp (based on challenge timebounds), and jti (challenge hash).

Parameters:
- transaction: Signed challenge transaction XDR (base64). Can be supplied as query param.
- challenge: Optional JSON body {"transaction": "..."} used by clients that POST JSON.

Returns:
- token: A HS256-signed JWT that the client may use as a Bearer token for authenticated requests.

Errors:
- 422: missing transaction.
- 400: invalid challenge XDR or failed signature/threshold checks.

parameters.name: transaction

schema.description: The signed challenge TransactionEnvelope XDR (base64). Can be supplied as a query parameter or in the request JSON body as {"transaction": "..."}.
schema.title: Transaction

parameters.description: The signed challenge TransactionEnvelope XDR (base64). Can be supplied as a query parameter or in the request JSON body as {"transaction": "..."}.

schema.description: Optional JSON body containing the transaction XDR. Used by clients that POST JSON.
schema.title: Challenge

get.summary: Get a quote of the current CARBON price in USD.
get.description:
Request a price quote for any amount of CARBON.

The response includes the total cost of the requested amount, as well as the average price
per CARBON. Both are denominated in USD.

This quote is non-binding and does not take into account the amount of CARBON that we are
currently able to provide from our pool.

parameters.name: carbon_amount

schema.description: requested amount of CARBON
schema.title: Carbon Amount

parameters.description: requested amount of CARBON

400.description: Horizon transaction has failed or is malformed

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

get.summary: Get the estimated amount of CARBON that can be purchased for the given price.
get.description:
Request the estimated amount of CARBON that can be purchased for a given USD amount.

The response includes the estimated total CARBON that can be obtained for the provided USD,
taking current pricing into account.

This estimate is non-binding and does not take into account the amount of CARBON that we are
currently able to provide from our pool (inventory or distribution constraints).

parameters.name: usd_amount

schema.description: requested amount of USD
schema.title: Usd Amount

parameters.description: requested amount of USD

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

post.summary: Build the XDR for a new CARBON sinking transaction.
post.description:
An offset is done by atomically swapping CARBON for CarbonSINK. This endpoint can be used to
build the XDR for such a sinking transaction.

If the funder does not have a sufficient balance of CARBON, a path payment will be used to
purchase the exact amount of CARBON to be retired. The most favorable rate will be selected
from the possible paths. The USDC value of this payment is included in the response for
convenience, but it is advisable to always check the generated XDR before signing and
submitting it to the network.

parameters.name: funder

schema.description: public key of the account that pays for the transaction
schema.title: Funder

parameters.description: public key of the account that pays for the transaction

parameters.name: recipient

schema.description: public key of the account that will receive CarbonSINK (default: funder)
schema.title: Recipient

parameters.description: public key of the account that will receive CarbonSINK (default: funder)

parameters.name: carbon_amount

schema.description: the amount of CARBON to sink
schema.title: Carbon Amount

parameters.description: the amount of CARBON to sink

parameters.name: payment_asset

schema.description: the preferred asset to pay with when the funder does not have a sufficient CARBON balance
schema.title: Payment Asset

parameters.description: the preferred asset to pay with when the funder does not have a sufficient CARBON balance

parameters.name: vcs_project_id

schema.description: carbon project from which credits will be retired
schema.title: Vcs Project Id

parameters.description: carbon project from which credits will be retired

parameters.name: memo_type

schema.description: the kind of memo that will be attached to the transaction
schema.title: Memo Type

parameters.description: the kind of memo that will be attached to the transaction

parameters.name: memo_value

schema.description: description of the reason for offsetting
schema.title: Memo Value

parameters.description: description of the reason for offsetting

get.summary: Get aggregated stats of the CARBON and CarbonSINK assets.
get.description:
Return aggregated CARBON and CarbonSINK asset statistics.

Definitions:
- carbon_sunk: total CARBON that users have sunk and swapped for CarbonSINK.
- carbon_retired: total CARBON for which VCUs have been permanently retired.
- carbon_pending: the difference between carbon_sunk and carbon_retired — CARBON
  that has been sunk and is awaiting retirement.
- carbon_stored: total amount of CARBON minted; the sum of CARBON and CarbonSINK
  in circulation.

400.description: Horizon transaction has failed or is malformed

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

get.summary: List sinking transactions for the given recipient account.
get.description:
Return paginated sinking (CARBON -> CarbonSINK) transactions for a recipient.

Optional filtering by finalized (retirement completed) is supported.

Returns:
- SinkTxListResponse containing transactions and paging information.

post.summary: Request the retirement of the whole credits in this account's pending balance.
post.description:
Request retirement of whole VCUs from the recipient's pending balance.

Enqueues an asynchronous retirement task and sends notification emails.

Returns:
- RequestCertificateResponse with account, certificate_amount and the remaining fractional pending balance.

Errors:
- 400 if there are no whole credits available to request.

parameters.name: recipient_address

schema.description: the address for which a retirement certificate will be issued
schema.title: Recipient Address

parameters.description: the address for which a retirement certificate will be issued

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

401.description: Authorization header is missing or malformed.

404.description: Recipient was not found in our database

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

get.summary: Estimate the CO₂ emissions for a flight between two airports.
get.description:
Estimate per-passenger CO₂ emissions for a flight between two airports.

Returns the airport names, the great-circle distance in kilometers, and an estimated
CO₂ emission per passenger. The estimate uses an internal aircraft model and
applies seat- and cabin-class adjustments; it should be treated as an approximation.

parameters.name: departure

schema.description: IATA code of the departure airport
schema.title: Departure

parameters.description: IATA code of the departure airport

parameters.name: destination

schema.description: IATA code of the destination airport
schema.title: Destination

parameters.description: IATA code of the destination airport

parameters.name: cabin_class

schema.description: Cabin class for the passenger

parameters.description: Cabin class for the passenger

parameters.name: trip_type

schema.description: One-way or round-trip
schema.title: Trip Type

parameters.description: One-way or round-trip

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

404.description: Airport not found. Unknown IATA code.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

get.summary: View finalized retirements and the attributes of the retired credits.
get.description:
Return a paginated list of finalized retirements along with a total retired amount.

Each retirement item includes certificate metadata, beneficiary information, associated
impact project and the retired instrument attributes. Filters for beneficiary, date range,
and project may be applied to narrow results. This endpoint is useful for browsing historical
retirement activity and retrieving aggregate totals.

schema.description: Only show retirements for the given beneficiary address.
schema.title: For Beneficiary

parameters.description: Only show retirements for the given beneficiary address.

schema.title: From Date

schema.description: Filter retirements that happened before the given date.
schema.title: Before Date

parameters.description: Filter retirements that happened before the given date.

get.summary: Fetch a single retirement and its instrument details.
get.description:
Fetch detailed information for a single retirement certificate.

The response includes the retirement's certificate metadata, the retired instrument's
attributes, the blocks from which credits were retired, and a list of sink statuses
associated with the retirement. If the requested certificate ID does not exist a 404
error is returned.

parameters.name: certificate_id

schema.description: The retirement's certificate ID
schema.title: Certificate Id

parameters.description: The retirement's certificate ID

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

404.description: Retirement was not found in our database

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

get.summary: View sinking transactions and their retirement status.
get.description:
Return a paginated list of sinking transactions together with aggregate totals.

Each transaction record includes source and destination asset details, funder and recipient
information, memo data, retirement summaries and a flag indicating whether retirement has
been finalized. The response also includes totals for sunk, retired and pending CARBON.

get.summary: Fetch a single sink transaction and its retirement status.
get.description:
Fetch a single sinking transaction and its retirement status.

The returned record is a transformed view of the stored transaction that includes
nested source/destination asset objects, memo details, a list of retirement summaries,
and a boolean indicating whether retirement has been finalized. A 404 error is returned
if the transaction is not present in the database.

parameters.name: tx_hash

schema.description: The sink transaction hash (64 hexadecimal characters)
schema.title: Tx Hash

parameters.description: The sink transaction hash (64 hexadecimal characters)

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

404.description: Transaction was not found in our database

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server
